Articles.Content:
2 Years after the initial revolt against the Vigilance Corporation, The Rebellion has risen from the ashes of it's predecessor, and vows to succeed where all else have failed.

The Vigilance Corporation launched Project Colossus, a series of operations launched by special mission units with objectives to destroy the insurgents, and their organization, bit by bit.

Peace and order, by force.

Chapter 1: Target: Praetorian.

As the screen buzzed with footage of the Praetorian H.A.W.C station launching it's duel missile payload against orders, with flight predictions and estimated casualties, the numbers of which ran into the billions. Details of the launch showed in large text: Priority: PARAMOUNT IMPORTANCE.Soon, a large button popped up on the otherwise green and black screen: ACTIVATE OMEGA TEAM Y/N, Lukas Kerman clicked yes and names popped up with portraits of the individual agents:

Kerman, Sigvan

Agent Call-sign: Wolf

Kerman, Sigson

Agent Call-sign: Coyote

Kerman, Ribvan

Agent Call-sign: Crow

Kerman, Mildred

Agent Call-sign: Hyena

He split them into two teams, Wolf and Hyena on one, Crow and Coyote on another, tasked with targeting each of the missiles en route to Kerbin, with only a few hours before they hit the atmosphere.

The two dropships launched immediately after he initiated the operation, with no briefing Omega team went out with clear orders: Destroy the warhead, and thus the missile. Sigvan sat in the left most pod of the dropship while Mildred sat on the right, they prepped themselves for the operation.

While they were veterans, Ribvan and Sigson were both rookies, only on a few other ops before hand with little experience. With the stakes so high, Sigvan thought it was a mistake to bring them, he thought it would be a better idea to bring a normal soldier with them, or a drone.

The mission was easy on paper, but in practice far too much could go wrong, with at least 8 sets of 24 military grade missiles with the capability to level 64% of a city from the center. Bill Kerman, who was operating the satellite has gone dark, and because the missile's detonation could be remotely controlled by intention, the elimination of an elite squad could easily be worth more then hurting the rebellion's public image.

Sigvan knew this. While Mildred had always assumed that the Rebels were little more then glorified terrorists, this attack fit into this persona. Sigvan could see beyond that an realize that they had a cause behind them, while he doesn't agree with the cause, and would fight it to the bitter end, it existed nonetheless.

Taking out an elite team? Worth it. Ruining your public image? Not worth it, nothing gained, everything lost.

As the dropship burned exiting the atmosphere, he continued to think "Speed is everything, move fast."

Nearly twenty minutes later, they were close to the missile, it stopped burning and simply stood still, it would hit the civilian target, it was time. The plan was for Sigvan and Mildred to place cruise missiles on the body of the missile and detonate them, detonating the warhead and destroying the missile.

The pods dropped and Sigvan got out, the missiles were dropped shortly after, along with a later and tether to stay attached. Sigvan grabbed the ladder and moved toward the missile.

"Moving up, keep ready."

Mildred attached the tether, and Sigvan the ladder, he also grabbed a different tether and placed it, they we now attached to the missile.

"Grab a missile, hit the warhead and probe core." Sigvan said, slightly agitated.

"Roger" Mildred said, confident in his own abilities.

"We have to move, keep the timeline." Sigvan replied, talking faster, trying to stay calm.

The Large missiles were attached to the probe core and warhead.

"Set, let's move Wolf" Said Mildred.

"Roger.

Overwatch, Omega 1, charges set, prep and ready for exfil over"

"Roger that" Said Lukas, under the call-sign, Overwatch.

"Let's move gents" Said Jorzor, one of the team's pilots.

Meanwhile, Sigson and Ribvan were both undergoing a similar situation, they had prepped the charges and were ready to leave, however, a brief tisk followed by a low rumbling sound a whhhhurrrrrrr.

Suddenly time slowed. Sigson faced the missile and watched as the warhead launched, pushing the two agents back toward the now spinning dropship as the white cloud burst into little shrapnel bits which narrowly missed the agents.

Ribvan, bashed by a piece of debris managed to yell: "ARGH, COMMAND, WE NEED TO GET OUT OF HERE"

Sigson and Ribvan barely avoided vaporization, Neil, the other pilot, tried to regain control of the dropship, to no avail and he was forced to evacuate.

"*Heavy breathing* Command... This is... This is agent Crow... We... We made it..."

"Roger, you guys okay?"

"I... I think so..."

Sigson couldn't move, he felt cold and his vision shook and throbbed, he was alive, but only barely.

"Sigson looks okay...*Calming down* You okay?"

Sigson was quiet.

"You with me? You okay? Talk to me Sig!"

Sigson finally came to.

"Yeah... I'm fine, I think..." He said, heavily breathing, trying to calm himself.

"Overwatch to Omega 2, what just happened up there?"

Ribvan talked first: "The missile blew, our dropship's gone. Over"

"Copy, can you last another 30 minutes?"

Sigson talked first this time "I think so..."

"Good, hang tight"

As they waited there to be rescued, they sometimes heard a fizzling and groaning, occasionally electric zolt sound, nothing they didn't pass off as what was left over of the missile.

But then, they saw something, something unimaginable, something that would bring even the mightiest of Vigilance Battlegroups to their knees.

"Uh... Overwatch?"

"KCHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"

"Overwatch?!"

"CHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"

"OVERWATCH?"

"Come in Omega 2?"

"You need to see this..."

"Patch us in...

Oh...My...God...

What is tha-?KCHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"

Edited June 25, 2014 by Special Agent Sigvan

Chapter 2: The Normandy

Lukas remained confused, the screen buzzed with errors as he tried to connect to the two agents stranded on orbit, as the light flicked and mechanical moans and electric fizzles ran throughout the compound. After a brief period of time everyone in the bunker was concerned, the mechanical groans soon made way for the thought of a mechanical malfunction. Soon Lukas got contact with the agents, it would only last for a few minutes, but it would do for now.

Ribvan's voice ran through the speakers, frightened and in desperate need of something

"OVERWATCH?!"

"Come in Omega 2"

"You...You have to see this..."

"Patch us in"

Images flashed up of a hefty Rebel cruiser, Letters on the side showing RSS NORMANDY with many other escorts, one of which scared them the most: A station designed similar to the H.A.W.C station, with a payload of IBBs, the bombs mounted inside the Missiles launched by the Praetorian.

Two of them we missing.

"Oh...My...God...

What is tha-"

The connection timed out, the images were the only thing on the screen now.

Lukas calmed himself, he knew what to do.

"Contact Central, send these images with it, they'll want to see this.

Scramble cruisers and Hunters, we need to take this thing out"

Twenty minutes later Central Command received the images and message sent with them, and they briefed a large team to board the cruisers and rescue the stranded agents.

"Welcome team, Spectre brief them"

The A.I. that controlled the majority of The Corporation's activities, Spectre, briefed the team.

"Of course Admiral. Team, you will be launched via dropship into the control room of the cruiser RSS Normandy, and terminate the internal crew. You will then activate self destruct protocols and utilize all ordnance on board to destroy the fleet.

Scrambling Cruisers, standby."

With the briefing over, they ran outside into their respective dropships, and watched as 12 Light Cruisers launched into orbit, prepping to destroy the rebel fleet.

When then, they heard another mechanical groan, and saw the IBB hit the ground near Central Command, nearly vaporizing everything inside and the last of the launching dropships.
